name: The Magdalen Chapter

reviews.text: Lovely hotel staffed by delightful people professionally trained to make our stay a most pleasurable one. The management must be strongly commended.
reviews.title: So Exeter - you are pretty good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole place has the feel of real luxury and this is borne out by the fleets of Rolls Rolls, Porsches, Ferraris and Maseratis packing the sadly but inevitably inadequate car park. My lovely newly cleaned (thank god) Land Rover felt very lowly in comparison.
reviews.title: A new Chapter in Exeter's history.

reviews.text: We did a deal but the hotel did well enough out of us as we ate profusely and drank a dozen different cocktails. The bar staff are lovely if informal at times. Breakfast was absolutely delicious with some imaginative and rather special cooked dishes on offer each morning added to a more than adequate buffet. Though we personally were not keen on the restaurant design it was comfortable and light and looked out on the lovely garden, swimming pool and spa. This is a very popular place with locals as well and deservedly so.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: Any gripes? Not really - the overflow bar is large and boasts a motley variety of furniture styles and needs some attention for that reason but it does a job and the bar food is very good value and again the staff are lovely and chatty.
reviews.title: Could be so good, but service really lets it down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely, extremely comfortable with a huge bed and crisp Egyptian cotton sheets. Every possible facility. Top marks.
reviews.title: Very very nice with a few small niggles

reviews.text: I met a friend for cocktails this week at the Magdalen and had the most amazing experience. The service was exceptional and the cocktail menu was of the highest standard! The bar snacks were amazing and I particularly enjoyed the ham croquettes! I thoroughly enjoyed my evening and I am recommending this luxurious hotel to all of my family and friends. The hotel interior was utterly beautiful and every staff member was friendly. I am looking forward to visiting this hotel again and sample more cocktails!
reviews.title: Exceptional service!

reviews.text: I met a friend for an after work drink. The staff were some of the best I have ever experienced including that of 5 star hotels in London and the Middle East. They were all enthusiastic and friendly without being obtrusive. I cannot praise them highly enough. Whoever recruits/trains staff at this hotel should be highly commended! The decor is a little too sparse and contemporary for me, but thats just personal taste, most people would think it very chic....I'm looking forward to returning for lunch or dinner next time. Well done guys!
reviews.title: Exceptional Staff!

reviews.text: I stayed at Magdalen Chapter at the end of July 2012, not long after it had been refurbished. I chose the hotel due to it's location, a 2 nights for the price of 1 offer and because it was newly refurbished and I was curious.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, disorganised restaurant.

reviews.text: The first night I stayed was the night before my wedding! I explained this to the reception staff when I made the booking and they suggested that they would "do something special" to celebrate the special occasion, but this didn't happen. I can overlook this though as the reception staff were extremely helpful and enthusiastic throughout my stay. I had lots of people coming up and down from my room on the morning of the wedding (hairdresser, beautician, bridesmaids etc) and they were all made to feel welcome and shown to the room each time.
reviews.title: Dining experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself: I was staying in the penthouse which although small was very stylish. As other guests have mentioned, the aircon doesn't seem to reflect the temperature stated on the monitor so I gave up with it and instead opened the doors to two lovely but small balconies that overlook the city. There is a complementary minibar and ren toiletries which were both appreciated, the bed is very comfortable and there was a decent flatscreen TV and comfy chairs. Room service was quick and unintrusive. A downside is that the water pressure in the shower isn't very good and it took me a long time to rinse the conditioner out of my hair! Also there was quite a lot of noise from the corridor, including the sounds of an amorous couple in the next room which I wouldn't have expected to have to listen to!
reviews.title: Great hotel...could be exceptional

reviews.text: I recently stayed here for 1 night. We had a ‘feature’ room, which was on the first floor overlooking the car park and offices opposite, so not very private unless the curtains were drawn. For £250 the room was on the small side. The hotel is dog friendly, and there were a few pets around the place.
reviews.title: Generally okay, a few minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has not been open very long, so areas are still a bit dusty, and the hotel employees, from cleaners to barman, are a friendly bunch, all smiles and helpful attitudes, which is great. The hotel has a funky vibe, a bit Malmaison, with all the dark purple carpets and flocky wallpaper.
reviews.title: Excellent Weekend Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The prices for food in the hotel are very expensive – we paid nearly £30 for 2 beers and 2 sandwiches.
reviews.title: THe little extras make a big difference!

reviews.text: The beds are very comfy – possibly the most comfortable le hotel bed I ever slept in!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The pool is okay, not heated particularly warm, but the inside-bit of the pool has a heater in it.
reviews.title: weekend at the Magdalen Chapter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent the night of my wedding anniversary here with my husband last week and it was lovely. I had read on their website that there was no specific car park, but there is one adjacent to the hotel, we parked here and were able to purchase a ticket from reception, who were very friendly and helpful. She took us up to our room, no 202 which was small but perfect for what we wanted. she showed us how to use the iPad and all the features of the room and then left us to it.
reviews.title: Lovely night of luxury

reviews.text: The iPad is genius - there is a Magdalen Chapter app with all the information on it you will probably ever need! You are also able to order spa products and room service on it, which we did. The food was divine and arrived within half an hour, though you were able to book it for whatever time you liked.
reviews.title: Special occasion experience yet great value for money.

reviews.text: The bed was very fluffy and comfy and the whole room very clean. The bathroom is a little disconcerting as it had frosted glass panels so you could see movement in the bathroom, but thankfully the toilet was covered!
reviews.title: Corporate Function

reviews.text: We were provided with fluffy towels, bathrobes and lovely toiletries which smelt gorgeous. the bath is a little narrow but nice and the shower is amazing. You also get a separate shower head to wash your hair in the bath!
reviews.title: Great little hideaway

reviews.text: The room had lovely high ceilings as well and big windows with a decent view.
reviews.title: Great !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over last week after a birthday dinner with friends and family. The room was very cool and the iPad in the room was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Perfect end to my 40th birthday party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very nice too and the view from the restaurant truly helped with my hangover!!!
reviews.title: Nearly very good, if only they changed the Bar Staff.

reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel which has been created from a former Eye Hospital.
reviews.title: Best hotel I've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very smart and trendy but a little on the small side. We did book the cheapest room so we really can't complain about the size.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel, can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable with nice linen. Bathrooms were smart and clean and had a very good shower.
reviews.title: Too many things wrong.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Thursday in February 2013 before heading to Bovey Castle for the weekend. It was much much better service than far more expensive Bovey. Free mini bar, excellent communal relaxing spaces, particularly Library and the Bar with traditional fire place. Good location 10 min walk from centre along a nice picturesque walk. Good value treatments in Spa and decent inside/outside swimming pool, with Jacuzzi. Breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on ground floor, and there was a problem on outside wall, where the old Victorian radiator started vibrating loudly, at 1a.m. They politely let us and next door room know what was happening, how and when they would fix it. In the end they just moved us to excellent v quiet suite room upstairs, not ideal at 2am but everything was dealt with professionally and courteously...like everything service was first class, willing always to help, and solved any problem you might have/or enquire upon. First class, will be returning.
reviews.title: No point crying over spilled milk - overall disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As is customary now, I read quite a few reviews on tripadvisor before committing to any hotel booking. This hotel ranked no 3 on the list in Exeter so it seemed a good choice for our main criteria, central location and quiet rooms for a peaceful night's sleep. We booked a 5 night stay on a room-only basis. All the positives like the iPad, pool, spa, restaurant, fluffy bathrobes, REN toiletries, etc that other postings on here mention are all true so there's nothing more to add there.
reviews.title: First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check-in was smooth and we were assured a quiet room on the first floor. We were shown to our room (102) and familiarised with all the facilities (the room is incredibly small so that didn't take long) and so we unpacked and settled in.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: We were on holiday so let's have a beer we thought and dived into the complimentary mini-bar. Yes, it is re-stocked daily with a can of coke, a diet coke, a lemonade, a bottle of beer and a mini bottle of wine plus a bar of Cadbury's chocolate and a small carton of fresh milk. However, a previous carton of milk had obviously been spilled in there at some point and hadn't been cleaned up properly. As a result the stench of sour milk was very strong when you opened the fridge door and the 4 drinking glasses also stored in the fridge had been welded to the bottom of the fridge by the milk - eeuuw! These things happen so I rang reception to ask for some clean glasses to be brought up and for the fridge to be cleaned. Over 40 minutes later and we were still waiting so I rang again. An apology and a 'oh haven't housekeeping been yet?' was the response. In the end the receptionist who'd checked us in brought the glasses herself. She had a whiff of the fridge, apologised and said she'd get it cleaned while we went for dinner. Unfortunately it took another 2 days of badgering and explaining to various members of staff that this was an issue before the fridge was actually cleaned properly but the smell remained for the entire stay. Remember, it's a small room and the fridge doubles up as a bedside table and the odour was not contained in the fridge so the room smelled of sour milk for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Very very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were keen to try the Restaurant at Magsalen Chapter. This hotel is in a lovely building, the former West of England Eye Infirmary and has been well renovated. The service was initially good, we were seated quickly and drinks orders taken and bread/butter served promptly. However despite there being many waitstaff, they seemed to lack attention to the diners requiring service, from ordering to obtaining the bill. The menu was uninspiring and the food was disappointing. We passed on dessert as it wasnt very inviting, vanilla icecream with chocolate sauce and peanuts is something we can make at home! This restaurant will need to improve significantly if it wishes for return customers.
reviews.title: Magdalen Chapter Restaurant disappointing

reviews.text: I went with friends to the restaurant to celebrate a birthday on a not so busy Monday night and we not impressed. The hotel itself was titillating and a jewel in an otherwise dull city. I think the architects at Feilden Clegg Bradley studios have delivered an understanding of their clients' needs. Its lovely, not moving to far away from the original structure and grandeur of the hospital building they have with utmost sensitivity and humanism pulled it in to the contemporary market. In design terms it appears a winner. The restaurant itself was fairly quiet, but it was a Monday night. We were shown to our table and given the menus which were taken away and replaced due to an alteration, we were then not seen by a server for almost 15 minutes. I flagged down one of the many inefficacious servers and asked for a wine list, an ipad was placed in the middle of the table with no explanation. I clearly was not interactive enough! But nor were the staff. Three servers saw to our needs badly. They were polite but flustered, well dressed but uncool with what they were actually supposed to be delivering. A simple menu with good ingredients and beautiful surroundings executed badly I am afraid. They were over staffed and unmanaged. Lets hope this is just a teething problem because the food was tasty but delivered with no passion or finesse which in turn mad the whole experience unremarkable. If apple made waiters?... So with your i pad in hand go and visit the Chapter house restaurant, you can sit opposite one another and tweet about how lovely the loos are. I will give it a few months to get over itself.
reviews.title: The Emperor's New Clothes.

reviews.text: I went with friends to the Restaurant last week-end and was not impressed.Firstly, we were told we had the wrong time.We booked for 8pm ( had confirmation email) which unfortunately we did not take with us, not thinking for one minute we would need it.Our table was eventually ready after 8.30pm. While waiting we had all decided what we would be eating,thinking maybe save some time.We were not served our main meal until 10.10pm. Service was very slow - even though there were plenty of staff.Will not be returning.
reviews.title: Restaurant - Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has got to be probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Love, love, love!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is trendy, stylish and modern whilst at the same time it stays true to its origins- the long windows which let plenty of natural light in, the bright corridors.
reviews.title: Meal out here...disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly I must say that the hotel itself is beautiful inside and out being in the heart of a wonderful city.
reviews.title: Reasonable, yet trying to hard to be too trendy and modern...

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a break away whilst seeing friends in Devon after our wedding, and what attracted us to this hotel is the fact that it had a spa and pool with treatments and that it had just outside opened.
reviews.title: Great food & smart surroundings

reviews.text: I was somewhat confused to the reception area but after feeling lost we were greeted by a receptionist. I was told that parking was free but actually it isn't, £3.70 added to our bill. I was given an ipad (£400 if it's broken etc) I didn't think I would need it but it gave me a lot of useful links and information.
reviews.title: beautiful buildings & beautiful people but the food could be better

reviews.text: The room was lovely, well presented, clean and spacious however the light functions are confusing and the ipad dock didn't work. My wife went to the spa and had a treatment whilst I had a dip in the pool. The pool was nice although cold and when I asked about having the fire lit in the 'fire room' I was told that it is only lit when it's raining and cold (which it was) so I was disappointed. My wife had an amazing massage and felt relaxed afterwards.
reviews.title: Welcome arrival of a new hotel in Exeter
Lovely surroundings - shambolick service
reviews.text: We decided to eat in at the hotel and again I wasn't dissatisfied, the bar staff were very helpful although I only got one type of olive in the 'mixed olives'. The restaurant was reasonably priced and of reasonable quality. The waiting staff were very helpful although their were 7 staff to 9 guests and yet service was slow.

description: The Magdalen Chapter combines old and new to create a stunning contemporary hotel. Service and quality are to the highest standard where integrated interiors and technology make your stay it’s most enjoyable. Situated close to the sophistication of Exeter’s centre, it's an ideal place to stay for a city break or to further explore Devon.
